subject: Re: junit cant find class
msgSnippet: First of all thanks for helping me. I have scoured the net searching for a fix, and it seems that there are a lot of similar problems but I cant seem to find
messageBody:
First of all thanks for helping me. I have scoured the net searching
for a fix, and it seems that there are a lot of similar problems but
I cant seem to find any answers. I have since changed the build.xml
around, creating a seperate dir for testing, emulating the dir
structure found at

http://www-106.ibm.com/developerworks/java/library/j-ant/

Therefore I am going to add the new targets and the "classpath"
Here it is.

<!--Project Classpath -->
<path id="classpath">
<pathelement location="build/test"/>
<pathelement
location="${dir.build}/edu/ggu/cis330/webclient/config"/>
<pathelement location="${dir.lib}/log4j-1.2.8.jar"/>
<pathelement location="${dir.lib}/xercesImpl.jar"/>
<pathelement location="${dir.lib}/xmlParserAPIs.jar"/>
<pathelement location="${dir.lib}/junit3.8.1.jar"/>
<pathelement path="${dir.base}"/>
<pathelement path="${dir.dist}/${file.jar}"/>
</path>

<target name="compile-tests" description="Test with JUnit"
depends="compile">
<mkdir dir="build/test"/>
<javac srcdir="src/test" destdir="build/test">
<classpath refid="classpath"/>
<include name="**/*.java"/>
</javac>
</target>

<target name="run-tests" description="Test with Junit"
depends="compile-tests">
<java
classname="junit.textui.TestRunner"
taskname="junit"
fork="true">
<arg value="test.TestMain"/>
<classpath refid="classpath"/>
</java>
</target>




--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...>
wrote:
> nathan wrote:
>
> > Hello,
> >
> > I have installed junit and am using ant to run it. I am new to
junit
> > and ant and have the following target declared in the buildfile.
> >
> > <target name="test" description="Test with Junit"
depends="compile">
> > <java
> > classname="junit.testui.TestRunner"
> > taskname="junit"
> > fork="true">
> > <arg value="edu.ggu.cis330.webclient.config.TestMain"/>
> > <classpath refid="classpath"/>
> > </java>
> > </target>
> >
> > but everytime i use "ant test" and run the test i get the
following
> > error:
> >
> > [junit] Class not found "edu.ggu.cis330.webclient.config.TestMain"
> >
> > i dont understand how this could be the case. can anyone help?
>
> Yes. Show us the content of your <classpath> entry with
id "classpath".
> --
> J. B. Rainsberger,
> Diaspar Software Services
> http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
